content: In the North Sea waters off the English coast, satellite monitoring appears to have detected a fishing vessel operating within approximately 100 meters of a Marine Protected Area boundary. This proximity suggests the vessel may have been engaged in 'fishing the line' - a practice where commercial fishing operations work as close as possible to protected area boundaries to access potentially productive waters where fish may aggregate along the edges of no-take zones. Such activities, while potentially legal depending on exact positioning and local regulations, raise concerns about compliance monitoring and the effectiveness of marine conservation boundaries.
